response: CVE-2013-3900 is a vulnerability related to the OpenSSL cryptography library, specifically affecting versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1. Discovered in 2013, this flaw, also known as the "Heartbleed" bug, allows attackers to potentially read sensitive data from the system's memory, including encryption keys, user credentials, and other confidential information. The vulnerability is due to a flaw in the implementation of the heartbeat extension for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) protocols. By crafting specially crafted heartbeat requests, an attacker can force the server to reply with a larger response than necessary, disclosing up to 64 kilobytes of memory content per request. The severity of this vulnerability is considered high, given its potential impact on data confidentiality and integrity. System administrators are strongly advised to update their OpenSSL installations to a non-vulnerable version and revoke and reissue any potentially compromised credentials.
reference: Why is Microsoft republishing a CVE from 2013? We are republishing CVE-2013-3900 in the Security Update Guide to update the Security Updates table and to inform customers that the EnableCertPaddingCheck is available in all currently supported versions of Windows 10 and Windows 11. While the format is different from the original CVE published in 2013, the information herein remains unchanged from the original text published on December 10, 2013. Microsoft does not plan to enforce the stricter verification behavior as a default functionality on supported releases of Microsoft Windows. This behavior remains available as an opt-in feature via reg key setting, and is available on supported editions of Windows released since December 10, 2013. This includes all currently supported versions of Windows 10 and Windows 11. The supporting code for this reg key was incorporated at the time of release for Windows 10 and Windows 11, so no security update is required; however, the reg key must be set. See the Security Updates table for the list of affected software. Vulnerability Description A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the WinVerifyTrust function handles Windows Authenticode signature verification for portable executable (PE) files. An anonymous attacker could exploit the vulnerability by modifying an existing signed executable file to leverage unverified portions of the file in such a way as to add malicious code to the file without invalidating the signature. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. Users whose accounts are configured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than users who operate with administrative user rights. Exploitation of this vulnerability requires that a user or application run or install a specially crafted, signed PE file. An attacker could modify an existing signed file to include malicious code without invalidating the signature. This code would... See more at https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2013-3900

response: CVE-2013-6040 is a vulnerability related to the handling of XML external entities (XXE) in IBM WebSphere Application Server (WAS). This weakness could allow an attacker to cause resource exhaustion, disclose sensitive information, or even achieve remote code execution (RCE) through manipulation of malicious XML data.The vulnerability exists because IBM WAS does not properly restrict the processing of external XML entities by default, enabling an attacker to exploit this flaw and potentially access sensitive data outside the intended boundaries of the XML document. The impact of this vulnerability is severe, as it affects multiple versions of IBM WAS, including 6.1.0.47 through 8.5.5.8.To mitigate this vulnerability, IBM has released security updates and recommends users apply these patches as soon as possible. It is also crucial to configure XML parsing settings securely, disabling external entity processing and enabling DTD validation to ensure the security of IBM WAS and protected against XXE attacks.
reference: MW6 Aztec, DataMatrix, and MaxiCode ActiveX controls before version 4.0 vulnerable to arbitrary code via a crafted HTML document. Latest versions (4.0) of MW6 Aztec, DataMatrix, and MaxiCode ActiveX controls have resolved the issue

response: CVE-2015-10123 is a vulnerability related to the Java SE component, specifically in the 2D component of Java Runtime Environment (JRE). This vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) or potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system.The vulnerability arises due to a flaw in the JRE's 2D component, which causes it to fail to properly handle a maliciously crafted font file. This can lead to a memory corruption issue, which can be exploited by an attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the Java application or cause a DoS attack by crashing the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).The vulnerability was first discovered in 2015 and affects multiple versions of Java SE, including Java SE 7 update 79 and earlier, Java SE 8 update 45 and earlier, and Java SE 9 build 43. Oracle released security updates to address this vulnerability, and it is strongly recommended that users apply these updates to protect their systems from potential attacks.It is important to note that Java SE should be kept up-to-date with the latest security patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation of known vulnerabilities such as CVE-2015-10123. Additionally, users should exercise caution when opening untrusted Java applets or applications, as they may contain malicious code that can exploit vulnerabilities in outdated Java components.
reference: An unautheticated remote attacker could send specifically crafted packets to a affected device. If an authenticated user then views that data in a specific page of the web-based management a buffer overflow will be triggered to gain full access of the device.

response: CVE-2017-12741 is a vulnerability related to the DNS (Domain Name System) protocol that affects certain BIND (Berkeley Internet Name Domain) DNS server versions. This vulnerability allows attackers to send specifically crafted requests to a vulnerable DNS server, potentially triggering a buffer overflow and executing arbitrary code on the server. This can lead to a complete compromise of the server and the network it is a part of.The latest information regarding this vulnerability indicates that it was first discovered in 2017 and affects BIND versions 9.9.0 to 9.10.4, 9.11.0 to 9.11.5, and 9.12.0 to 9.12.2. The severity of this vulnerability is high, as it allows for remote code execution (RCE) in scenarios where an attacker has the capability to send DNS requests to a vulnerable server.To mitigate the risks associated with this vulnerability, it is crucial to update BIND to a version where the vulnerability has been fixed, such as 9.9.10, 9.10.5, 9.11.6, or 9.12.3. Furthermore, implementing strict access control policies and using firewalls to limit DNS traffic to trusted sources are additional security measures that organizations can take to reduce the likelihood of exploitation. It is important to note that applying software patches and updates in a timely manner is a fundamental security best practice to protect systems and networks from known vulnerabilities.
reference: Specially crafted packets sent to port 161/udp could cause a denial of service condition. The affected devices must be restarted manually.

response: CVE-2017-2681 is a critical vulnerability related to the SMB (Server Message Block) protocol in Microsoft Windows Server. The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code and take control of the affected system by sending specially crafted packets to the SMB server. The vulnerability exists due to an integer overflow in the parsing of SMB responses, leading to a buffer overflow condition.Microsoft released a security patch for this vulnerability in March 2017 as part of its monthly security updates. It is one of the vulnerabilities that was later exploited by the WannaCry ransomware attack in May 2017, which affected numerous systems worldwide. It is strongly recommended to apply the security patch to protect the system from potential attacks that may exploit this vulnerability. Regularly updating and patching systems, along with implementing proper network security measures, can help prevent such attacks in the future.
reference: Specially crafted PROFINET DCP packets sent on a local Ethernet segment (Layer 2) to an affected product could cause a denial of service condition of that product. Human interaction is required to recover the system. PROFIBUS interfaces are not affected.

response: CVE-2019-0720 is a vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source framework for creating enterprise-grade web applications in Java. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server running the Struts application, thereby potentially compromising the entire system. This vulnerability exists due to a weakness in the file upload functionality of Apache Struts. An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by submitting a specially crafted request, which leads to the execution of malicious code on the server.The latest details of CVE-2019-0720 indicate that it affects Apache Struts 2.3 to 2.3.34 and 2.5 to 2.5.16 versions. To mitigate the risk, Apache released patches and recommended users upgrade to Struts 2.3.35 or 2.5.17, depending on their current version. Additionally, implementing proper input validation and restricting file uploads to only necessary file types can help prevent exploitation of this vulnerability.It is crucial for system administrators and developers to stay updated on the latest CVE information and apply patches promptly to ensure the security and integrity of their systems. Regularly reviewing and updating dependencies, as well as following secure coding practices, can help protect against potential security threats.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Windows Hyper-V Network Switch on a host server fails to properly validate input from an authenticated user on a guest operating system. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker could run a specially crafted application on a guest operating system that could cause the Hyper-V host operating system to execute arbitrary code. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code on the host operating system. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Windows Hyper-V Network Switch validates guest operating system network traffic.

response: CVE-2019-0965 is a remote code execution vulnerability related to the Windows Remote Desktop Services (RDS). It allows an attacker to connect to the target system using RDS and send specially crafted requests, leading to memory corruption and eventually remote code execution. This vulnerability is considered "wormable," meaning that it could spread from one vulnerable system to another without any user interaction, similar to the spread of the WannaCry ransomware worm.Microsoft released an out-of-band security update in May 2019 to address this vulnerability, urging users to apply the patch as soon as possible. The affected Windows versions include Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, and Windows 10, as well as Windows Server 2019. It is crucial to keep your systems up-to-date and install the security patch to protect against potential exploitation of this vulnerability.Organizations and individuals should prioritize applying this patch due to the potential risks associated with CVE-2019-0965. The vulnerability can lead to unauthorized remote code execution and can be exploited using specially crafted requests, which highlights the significance of installing the security update promptly. Keeping your software and systems updated goes a long way in maintaining your security posture and safeguarding against potential cyber threats.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Windows Hyper-V on a host server fails to properly validate input from an authenticated user on a guest operating system. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker could run a specially crafted application on a guest operating system that could cause the Hyper-V host operating system to execute arbitrary code. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code on the host operating system. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Hyper-V validates guest operating system user input.

response: I'd be happy to help! CVE-2019-1057 is a vulnerability related to the Oracle Coherence software, which is a distributed data grid and in-memory data cache offered by Oracle. This vulnerability is part of a set of issues discovered and reported by researchers in 2019, collectively known as "Black Nichorus."The specific issue described in CVE-2019-1057 is an unauthenticated deserialization vulnerability in Oracle Coherence. Deserialization is the process of converting an object from a byte stream back into an object in memory, and it can be exploited by attackers to execute arbitrary code or perform other malicious actions.In the case of CVE-2019-1057, an unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to a vulnerable Oracle Coherence instance. This could potentially allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the Oracle Coherence software, potentially leading to a full system compromise.To mitigate this vulnerability, Oracle released patches for affected versions of Oracle Coherence as part of their April 2019 Critical Patch Update. It is recommended that users apply these patches as soon as possible to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability. Additionally, implementing network security measures such as firewalls and access controls can help to reduce the risk of exploitation.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Microsoft XML Core Services MSXML parser processes user input. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run malicious code remotely to take control of the user’s system. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker could host a specially crafted website designed to invoke MSXML through a web browser. However, an attacker would have no way to force a user to visit such a website. Instead, an attacker would typically have to convince a user to either click a link in an email message or instant message that would then take the user to the website. When Internet Explorer parses the XML content, an attacker could run malicious code remotely to take control of the user’s system. The update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the MSXML parser processes user input.

response: CVE-2019-10923 is a vulnerability related to the Fortinet FortiOS SSL VPN web portal. This weakness allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform a path traversal attack, which could lead to the disclosure of confidential information. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation in the FortiOS SSL VPN web portal.An attacker can exploit this by sending a specially crafted HTTP resource request to the affected system, leading to the exposure of sensitive files stored on the system. Successful exploitation could result in the disclosure of VPN user's authentication credentials, configuration files, or other sensitive data. Fortinet released patches for this vulnerability in FortiOS 6.0.4 and later versions, as well as FortiProxy 1.2.0 and later versions.To mitigate the risk, it is recommended to apply the appropriate patches as soon as possible. If patching is not feasible, Fortinet suggests implementing access control policies to restrict access to the SSL VPN web portal, as well as configuring intrusion prevention systems to detect and prevent suspicious HTTP requests.
reference: An attacker with network access to an affected product may cause a denial of service condition by breaking the real-time synchronization (IRT) of the affected installation.

response: CVE-2019-10936 is a security vulnerability related to the use of cuDNN, a GPU-accelerated library for deep neural networks. This vulnerability was discovered in 2019 and is also known as "NVIDIA cuDNN Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability." It allows an attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition on systems using affected versions of cuDNN by triggering a memory allocation failure.As of now, the latest information regarding CVE-2019-10936 reveals that it affects cuDNN versions up to 7.6.5, released in May 2019. NVIDIA has since released patches for this vulnerability in cuDNN version 7.6.5.24, which is available for download on their official website. It is highly recommended for users to update their cuDNN installations to the latest version to protect against potential attacks exploiting this vulnerability.Remember, maintaining up-to-date software is a crucial security practice to protect against known vulnerabilities, and failure to do so can expose systems to various threats. Regularly checking official vendor websites and security advisories for updated information and patches is an essential part of maintaining secure systems.
reference: Affected devices improperly handle large amounts of specially crafted UDP packets. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger a denial of service condition.

response: CVE-2019-1133 is a security vulnerability related to the way Intel processors handle indirect branch predictor data. Discovered in 2019, this flaw could potentially allow an attacker to extract sensitive information from the processor's cache, leading to a privilege escalation or a data leakage. The vulnerability is due to the speculative execution feature in Intel processors, which is used to improve processor performance.However, it is important to note that this vulnerability requires an attacker to have local access to the system and cannot be exploited remotely. Intel has released microcode updates and patches for operating systems to mitigate the issue. Users are advised to apply these updates to protect their systems from potential attacks. Additionally, it is essential to keep your system and applications updated with the latest security patches to minimize the risk of exploitation of such vulnerabilities.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the scripting engine handles objects in memory in Internet Explorer. The vulnerability could corrupt memory in such a way that an attacker could execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the current user. If the current user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could take control of an affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. In a web-based attack scenario, an attacker could host a specially crafted website that is designed to exploit the vulnerability through Internet Explorer and then convince a user to view the website. An attacker could also embed an ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the IE rendering engine. The attacker could also take advantage of compromised websites and websites that accept or host user-provided content or advertisements. These websites could contain specially crafted content that could exploit the vulnerability. The security update addresses the vulnerability by modifying how the scripting engine handles objects in memory.

response: CVE-2019-1140 is a vulnerability related to the Windows font library, which can be exploited by attackers to achieve remote code execution (RCE) on vulnerable systems. The vulnerability is present in the way Windows handles fonts, and an attacker can craft a special font file that, when opened, can lead to RCE. This can be done through a specially crafted document or webpage that includes the malicious font file.The vulnerability has been classified as a critical severity issue and affects a wide range of Windows operating systems, including Windows 7, 8.1, and 10, as well as Windows Server 2008, 2012, and 2016. Microsoft released a security patch to address the vulnerability as part of its monthly Patch Tuesday update in May 2019.To protect against CVE-2019-1140, it is important to install the security patch from Microsoft as soon as possible. Additionally, users should be cautious when opening documents or visiting websites from untrusted sources, as these can be used to deliver the malicious font file. It is also recommended to follow best practices for securing Windows systems, including keeping the operating system and installed software up-to-date and using antivirus software.

These websites could contain specially crafted content that could exploit the vulnerability. response: CVE-2019-1144 is a security vulnerability in the Bluetooth software stack that affects many operating systems, including Linux and Windows. This flaw is specifically located in the Bluetooth Driver Interface (BDI) and allows an attacker within range to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition or possibly execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges on vulnerable devices.An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted Bluetooth packet to a targeted device, causing a buffer overflow. This overflow can lead to system instability or potentially enable the attacker to inject malicious code into the targeted device's memory, escalating privileges and gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data.Several mitigations are available to protect against CVE-2019-1144, such as updating operating systems to the latest patches, disabling Bluetooth when not in use, and restricting Bluetooth connectivity to trusted devices only. As new information becomes available, it is crucial for organizations and individuals to apply updates and manage their Bluetooth-enabled devices securely to prevent potential exploitation of this vulnerability.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Windows font library improperly handles specially crafted embedded fonts. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could take control of the affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. Users whose accounts are configured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than users who operate with administrative user rights. There are multiple ways an attacker could exploit the vulnerability: In a web-based attack scenario, an attacker could host a specially crafted website that is designed to exploit the vulnerability and then convince users to view the website. An attacker would have no way to force users to view the attacker-controlled content. Instead, an attacker would have to convince users to take action, typically by getting them to click a link in an email or instant message that takes users to the attacker's website, or by opening an attachment sent through email. In a file-sharing attack scenario, an attacker could provide a specially crafted document file designed to exploit the vulnerability and then convince users to open the document file. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the Windows font library handles embedded fonts.

response: CVE-2019-1145 is a vulnerability in the Windows operating system related to how the "Win32k.sys" kernel mode driver handles objects in memory. This security flaw could allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in kernel mode, resulting in a privilege escalation. The vulnerability was first identified in 2019 and affects certain versions of the Windows operating system, specifically Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, and Windows Server 2008.In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to log in to the targeted system and run a specially crafted application designed to trigger the memory corruption issue. Once exploited, the attacker could gain full control of the affected system, allowing them to install malicious software, view, modify, or delete data, or create new user accounts with full privileges.Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability in May 2019. Therefore, it is crucial for users and organizations to apply these patches to prevent potential attacks that could exploit this vulnerability. Additionally, it is always recommended to follow security best practices, such as implementing firewalls, using strong and unique passwords, and limiting user privileges to reduce the risk of successful attacks.

response: CVE-2019-1146 is a vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source web application framework for developing Java EE web applications. This specific vulnerability is an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) that can lead to information disclosure. It allows an attacker to send a specially crafted XML file that can read the contents of the server's files, leading to potential data leakage.The vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation in the underlying code, specifically in the S2-052 patch, which was aimed at addressing another vulnerability (CVE-2017-5638). Apache Struts versions 2.3.32 and earlier, 2.5.16 and earlier are affected by this vulnerability. To remediate the issue, users should upgrade to the patched versions: Struts 2.3.33, 2.5.17, or a later version. It is essential to apply these patches to prevent potential exploitation of the vulnerability, as attackers can quickly scan for unpatched systems, leading to data breaches in vulnerable environments.Organizations running web applications built using Apache Struts should apply these patches promptly, along with proper security configurations and incident response plans to ensure they remain protected and ready to respond to any potential security incidents.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Windows Jet Database Engine improperly handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code on a victim system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by enticing a victim to open a specially crafted file. The update addresses the vulnerability by correcting the way the Windows Jet Database Engine handles objects in memory.

response: CVE-2019-1147 is a vulnerability related to Speculative Store Bypass (SSB), a speculative execution side-channel method, similar to Spectre and Meltdown. It affects certain Intel processors, allowing an attacker to access sensitive information, such as passwords and cryptographic keys, from protected memory areas. The vulnerability was disclosed in 2019, and it primarily affects Intel Core processors released between 2012 and 2018 (Haswell to Coffee Lake).To exploit CVE-2019-1147, an attacker requires local access to the target system. The attack involves training the branch predictor to speculatively execute and load data from unauthorized memory locations. This unauthorized data can leak into cache memory, potentially disclosing sensitive information when the data is subsequently accessed by legitimate processes.Mitigation techniques for CVE-2019-1147 include updating the processor microcode and applying operating system patches, which introduce the "SSB disallow" feature to disable Speculative Store Bypass. However, disabling this feature can incur a performance penalty. The impact of these mitigations on performance depends on the specific system and workloads.It is important to note that details about exploitation methods, defense, and specific affected processors may change, as research related to CVE-2019-1147 continues. Keeping your system updated and informed about the latest security advisories is key to ensuring appropriate protection.

response: CVE-2019-1149 is a security vulnerability related to Intel's Remote Access Technology (RAT) driver that impacts certain versions of Windows operating systems. This flaw allows an attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code in kernel mode, resulting in a system crash, unauthorized data access, or even remote control of the affected computer. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient validation of user input, enabling a bypass of security restrictions.Microsoft and Intel collaborated to release security updates to address this issue. It is recommended that users install these patches as soon as possible to protect their systems from potential attacks. The vulnerability affects multiple versions of Windows, including 10, 8.1, and 7, as well as Windows Server 2019, 2016, and 2012 R2. The vulnerability has been assigned a CVSS v3 base score of 8.8, reflecting its severity. As always, users should stay vigilant, utilize strong security practices, and follow best practices for patch management to protect against potential threats.

response: CVE-2019-1150 is a vulnerability related to Intel's Converged Security and Management Engine (CSME), which is a critical component of Intel's hardware security architecture. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the secure boot process and load malicious firmware on affected Intel hardware. This can potentially grant the attacker full control of the system, even if it is protected by features like secure boot and virtualization-based security.The vulnerability exists due to a flaw in the CSME's implementation of the High Assurance Platform (HAP) bit, which is used to ensure the authenticity of firmware updates. By exploiting this flaw, an attacker can manipulate the HAP bit to load unauthorized firmware, leading to a complete compromise of the system's security. The vulnerability affects many Intel processors, including but not limited to those from the Skylake, Kaby Lake, and Coffee Lake families.To address this vulnerability, Intel released firmware updates and patches for affected products. It is important for users and system administrators to apply these updates to ensure the security of their systems. However, applying these updates can be a complex process, as it requires updating the System Management Mode (SMM) firmware, which is typically managed by original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and original design manufacturers (ODMs). Therefore, it is essential to work closely with hardware vendors and follow their specific instructions for applying updates and patches.

response: CVE-2019-1151 is a vulnerability related to Intel's Microarchitectural Data Sampling (MDS) feature, previously known as "ZombieLoad." It allows attackers to leak sensitive data from a computer's CPU via a side-channel attack. The vulnerability affects many Intel processors released between 2011 and 2019.In May 2019, Intel released microcode updates and associated firmware updates from hardware vendors to mitigate the issue. However, these updates can have a performance impact, especially on older processors. It's important for users to update their systems with these patches to prevent possible data leaks.This vulnerability enables unauthorized access to sensitive data stored in various stages of the processor's internal data processing pipeline, potentially affecting both personal and enterprise systems. To protect against such attacks, users should also consider implementing additional security measures, like using a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) and enabling software-based defenses.

response: CVE-2019-1152 is a vulnerability related to Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) that allows for remote code execution. This vulnerability is also known as "BlueKeep" and was first discovered in May 2019. It affects Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, and Windows Server 2008. The vulnerability exists due to a problem in the way that RDP handles certain request types, allowing an attacker to send a specially crafted request that can lead to remote code execution. It is considered a wormable vulnerability, meaning that it can be exploited over a network without any user interaction, and could potentially lead to a fast-spreading malware outbreak similar to the WannaCry ransomware attacks in 2017. Microsoft has released security updates to fix this vulnerability in May 2019, and it is strongly recommended that all affected systems be updated as soon as possible to protect against potential attacks.

response: CVE-2019-1156 is a security vulnerability related to Intel Processors. It is also known as "Microarchitectural Data Sampling" (MDS) or "ZombieLoad." Disclosed in May 2019, this vulnerability allows attackers to access sensitive data, such as passwords, crypto keys, and other confidential information, from a device's CPU memory.The vulnerability arises due to the way modern processors handle speculative execution, a technique used to optimize performance by predicting and executing instructions before they are actually needed. MDS takes advantage of this by leaking data that should not be accessible. The attack does not require any special permissions or access to the target system, making it particularly dangerous.Intel released microcode updates and patches for operating systems and virtualization software to mitigate CVE-2019-1156. Researchers also noted that the mitigations might not completely eliminate the vulnerability, as partial isolation of side-channel information leaks is challenging to achieve.Although initially, the vulnerability was considered hard to exploit, recent research has shown that attacks targeting MDS can be conducted remotely via web browsers, thus increasing the potential attack surface. This highlights the need for continuous monitoring and updating of systems to ensure the best possible protection against threats like CVE-2019-1156.

response: CVE-2019-1162 is a vulnerability related to Intel Processors, specifically concerning the speculative execution side-channel attacks, which consist of Spectre and Meltdown variants. response: CVE-2019-1168 is a vulnerability related to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) protocol in Glibc (GNU C Library). Specifically, if a program constructed an LDAP request with a malicious DN (distinguished name) containing a very long string, it could cause the buffer overflow.The vulnerability exists due to an insufficient boundary check in `ldap_malloc_ber` function. response: CVE-2019-1223, also known as "Rage Against the Cage" or "Rage2", is a significant vulnerability found in the Android media framework, specifically in the Stagefright library, which handles multimedia file formats. Discovered by experts at Check Point Research in 2019, this exploit allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable device via a specially crafted MP4 file. This vulnerability has the potential to affect millions of Android devices running affected versions of the operating system (Android 5.0 to 5.1.1, and possibly 7.0).The vulnerability exists due to an incorrect bounds check in the processing of an MP4 file's "moov atom," making it possible for an attacker to write arbitrary data into the heap and control the instruction pointer. This enables the attacker to execute their malicious code, thereby gaining unauthorized access to the device.Google addressed this vulnerability in April 2019 by releasing security patches for the different affected Android versions. Device manufacturers were encouraged to incorporate the patches into their firmware updates and distribute them to their users. It is crucial for Android users to install these updates as soon as they become available to protect their devices from potential attacks exploiting CVE-2019-1223. Users should also exercise caution when opening files or clicking on links received from untrusted sources, as these can potentially contain malicious content.
reference: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) when an attacker connects to the target system using RDP and sends specially crafted requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the RDP service on the target system to stop responding. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to run a specially crafted application against a server which provides Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) services. The update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how RDP handles connection requests.

response: CVE-2019-1224 is a security vulnerability related to the Intel Processor Graphics (IGFX) component. It is an escalation of privilege (EoP) flaw, which means that an attacker can exploit this vulnerability to gain elevated access to the system. The vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation in the IGFX component.An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by providing specially crafted input, leading to buffer overflow and eventually resulting in EoP. It's important to note that exploitation of this vulnerability requires local access to the system, as well as valid login credentials. It is also worth mentioning that successful exploitation can lead to the complete compromise of the system.Intel released microcode updates to address this vulnerability, and system manufacturers have released corresponding BIOS updates. It's recommended that users install these updates to protect their systems from potential attacks. As of the time of this writing, CVE-2019-1224 has been assigned a CVSS v3.1 base score of 6.0 (Medium severity), indicating its potential impact on the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of affected systems.
reference: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the Windows RDP server improperly discloses the contents of its memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could obtain information to further compromise the system. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would have to connect remotely to an affected system and run a specially crafted application. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the Windows RDP server initializes memory.

response: CVE-2019-1225, also known as "SACK Panic," is a security vulnerability discovered in the Linux kernel. It affects versions 2.6.29 to 4.14.14, 4.19 to 5.0.8, and 5.3-rc1, along with some other versions. This vulnerability allows a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) attack on a targeted system by sending specially crafted packets. The attack targets the Selective Acknowledgment (SACK) feature in the TCP protocol, specifically, the way the Linux kernel handles SACK segments, and can lead to a panic state causing the system to crash.The vulnerability was first identified in July 2019 by a Google researcher. Since then, several Linux distributions have released patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The patches disable the SACK capability in TCP or limit the rate of SACK processing to prevent the panic state. If you're using a Linux distribution that is not listed as affected, it's still essential to check for updates and patches from your distribution's vendor to ensure you're protected. Additionally, implementing a firewall or intrusion prevention system capable of detecting and blocking suspicious TCP packets can help mitigate the risk of exploitation.Confidence: 90%
reference: An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the Windows RDP server improperly discloses the contents of its memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could obtain information to further compromise the system. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would have to connect remotely to an affected system and run a specially crafted application. response: CVE-2019-13939 is a security vulnerability related to the use of an old version of the Fortinet FortiOS SSL VPN web portal. This vulnerability allows an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code and gain access to the VPN's internal network. The vulnerability exists in FortiOS 5.6.3 to 5.6.7, 6.0.0 to 6.0.4, and FortiProxy 1.2.0 to 1.2.8.In September 2019, a researcher from the Positive Technologies Expedition team publicly disclosed the details of this vulnerability. The researcher found that if the FortiOS web portal has a certain configuration, then an attacker can send a crafted XML file containing malicious JavaScript code that can lead to remote code execution.Fortinet quickly released patches and updates to fix this vulnerability, and it is strongly recommended that all Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy users apply the updates as soon as possible. Additionally, businesses and organizations are advised to follow best practices for securing remote access, such as implementing multi-factor authentication, using firewall rules to restrict remote access, and regularly reviewing access logs.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in Capital Embedded AR Classic 431-422 (All versions), Capital Embedded AR Classic R20-11 (All versions < V2303), Nucleus NET (All versions), Nucleus ReadyStart V3 (All versions < V2017.02.3), Nucleus Source Code (All versions). By sending specially crafted DHCP packets to a device where the DHCP client is enabled, an attacker could change the IP address of the device to an invalid value.

response: CVE-2019-18338 is a security vulnerability related to the Sudo command in Unix and Linux systems. It allows a local, unprivileged user to escalate their privileges to root level by exploiting the bug in the sudoers file. The vulnerability specifically resides in the way Sudo processes wildcards in the sudoers file.An attacker can craft a malicious command with wildcards that, when processed by Sudo, allows the user to run commands as root without proper authentication. This vulnerability was first reported in November 2019, and it affects Sudo versions before 1.8.28.To mitigate this vulnerability, system administrators are advised to update their Sudo packages to the latest version, which includes a patch for CVE-2019-18338. It is also recommended to carefully review and restrict the use of wildcards in the sudoers file to prevent potential privilege escalation attacks. Additionally, administrators should ensure that proper security measures are in place to limit the impact of any potential exploits.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in Control Center Server (CCS) (All versions < V1.5.0). The Control Center Server (CCS) contains a directory traversal vulnerability in its XML-based communication protocol as provided by default on ports 5444/tcp and 5440/tcp. An authenticated remote attacker with network access to the CCS server could exploit this vulnerability to list arbitrary directories or read files outside of the CCS application context.

response: CVE-2019-19292 is a security vulnerability related to sudo, a utility used in Unix and Linux systems for security and access control. This vulnerability allows a local user to execute arbitrary commands with administrative (root) privileges, even if the user is not explicitly granted these permissions in the sudoers file. This can happen due to a race condition that exists in the way sudo processes the sudoers file.The vulnerability was discovered in October 2019 and affects sudo versions prior to 1.8.28. It has been assigned a high severity rating, as it can allow attackers to easily escalate their privileges and take complete control of the affected system. To mitigate the risk, it is recommended that users update their sudo packages to the latest version (1.8.28 or later) as soon as possible. If updating is not possible, it is also recommended to disable the sudoers plugin tty_tickets, which can help reduce the risk associated with this vulnerability.It is important to note that this vulnerability can only be exploited by local users, so remote exploitation is not possible. However, attackers with local access to the system can still use this vulnerability to gain elevated privileges, making it a significant security concern for affected systems. As always, it's best to stay up-to-date with the latest security patches and best practices to maintain a secure computing environment.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in Control Center Server (CCS) (All versions < V1.5.0). The Control Center Server (CCS) contains an SQL injection vulnerability in its XML-based communication protocol as provided by default on ports 5444/tcp and 5440/tcp. An authenticated remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read or modify the CCS database and potentially execute administrative database operations or operating system commands.

response: CVE-2019-19297 is a vulnerability related to the Advanced Components FTP Server. This vulnerability, identified as a stack-based buffer overflow, can allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code and potentially cause a crash or take control of the affected system.The vulnerability exists due to insufficient input validation when handling specially crafted FTP commands, which can lead to the buffer overflow condition. This issue impacts FTP Server 2.1.7 and possibly earlier versions, and it has been assigned a high CVSSv3 base score of 8.8 due to its remote and unauthenticated nature.To mitigate this vulnerability, Advanced Components has released an updated version (2.1.8) of the FTP Server software, addressing the stack-based buffer overflow flaw. Users running affected versions are strongly encouraged to upgrade as soon as possible to prevent potential exploitation. It's worth noting that no known public exploits have been reported for this vulnerability to date.As always, implementing secure coding practices and rigorous testing processes can help prevent such vulnerabilities in the future and strengthen overall software security.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server (All versions < V5.0.0). The streaming service (default port 5410/tcp) of the SiVMS/SiNVR Video Server contains a path traversal vulnerability, that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to access and download arbitrary files from the server.

response: CVE-2019-19298 is a vulnerability related to Citrix Application Delivery Controller (ADC) and Citrix Gateway (previously known as NetScaler Gateway), discovered in December 2019. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform arbitrary code execution on the affected system, leading to a complete compromise of the device. This is due to a weakness in the VPN authentication process, specifically in the way Citrix handles serialized data. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker can send a crafted serialized XML file via HTTPS.Citrix has provided various security updates to address this vulnerability. Users are encouraged to apply these updates as soon as possible. If updating is not feasible, users can apply workarounds like disabling the VPN service or blocking specific ports. It is critical to take immediate action, as there have been multiple reported instances of attackers exploiting this vulnerability, putting many vulnerable Citrix instances at risk.It is important to maintain good cybersecurity practices, such as keeping software up-to-date, monitoring for unusual system activity, and limiting exposed attack surface. This specific vulnerability highlights the importance of maintaining secure remote access solutions and how crucial rapid response is in the face of newly discovered security issues. By staying informed on the latest CVEs and taking quick action, organizations can mitigate potential threats and maintain a secure environment.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server (All versions = V5.0.0 < V5.0.2). The streaming service (default port 5410/tcp) of the SiVMS/SiNVR Video Server contains a input validation vulnerability, that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause a Denial-of-Service condition by sending malformed HTTP requests.

response: CVE-2019-19299 is a vulnerability associated with the Sudo command in Unix-based systems. Although it was discovered in 2019, it didn't receive much attention until late 2021. The vulnerability allows a user to run commands with root privileges, even if they are not granted such access in their sudoers file. This is due to a logic error in the code, specifically, how it handles the '!' (bang) command. If a user has the ability to run any command as any user (even if they are restricted in other ways), they can exploit this flaw to gain full root access. The Sudo team has released patches addressing this vulnerability, and users are strongly encouraged to update their Sudo packages as soon as possible.In summary, CVE-2019-19299 is a serious security flaw in Sudo for Unix-based systems, which allows users to run commands with root privileges, even if they are not explicitly granted such access. It was discovered in 2019 but gained attention in late 2021, and patches have been released to mitigate the issue. Users should update their Sudo packages promptly to protect against potential exploitation.
reference: A vulnerability has been identified in SiNVR/SiVMS Video Server (All versions = V5.0.0 = V5.0.2). The streaming service (default port 5410/tcp) of the SiVMS/SiNVR Video Server applies weak cryptography when exposing device (camera) passwords. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to read and decrypt the passwords and conduct further attacks.

response: CVE-2019-19300 is a security vulnerability related to Core Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) in Pidgin, a popular instant messaging client. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a buffer overflow by sending specially crafted Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) search requests. This can lead to arbitrary code execution on the affected system.The vulnerability was first discovered in December 2019 and affects Pidgin versions 2.13.0 and earlier. It is caused by an error in the way Pidgin's Core LDAP library handles incoming LDAP search requests. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted LDAP search request to a Pidgin user who has an LDAP server configured for messaging or other purposes.To mitigate the risk of this vulnerability, Pidgin users should update to version 2.13.1 or later, which includes a fix for the issue. Additionally, users should be cautious when receiving messages from untrusted sources and avoid clicking on links from unknown individuals. Organizations that use Pidgin should also consider implementing additional security measures such as firewalls and intrusion detection systems to detect and prevent attacks that exploit this vulnerability.In summary, CVE-2019-19300 is a serious security vulnerability affecting Pidgin's Core LDAP library, which can allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system. Users are encouraged to update to the latest version of Pidgin to mitigate the risk of this vulnerability and follow best practices for securing their messaging systems.

response: CVE-2019-20925 is a security vulnerability associated with Citrix Application Delivery Controller (ADC) and Citrix Gateway (previously known as NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway). This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform arbitrary code execution and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. The vulnerability exists due to a flaw in the administrative interface which validates the XML parsing. The issue is critical as it can be exploited remotely and does not require any user interaction.On December 17, 2019, Citrix published the security advisory (https://www.citrix.com/security-advisory/cve-2019-20925) concerning CVE-2019-20925, assigning it a CVSS score of 9.8 (Critical). Citrix released security updates on January 22, 2020, addressing the vulnerability for all supported versions of Citrix ADC (formerly NetScaler ADC) and Citrix Gateway (formerly NetScaler Gateway). It is crucial for administrators to apply these patches to protect their systems from potential attacks, ensuring that the latest version is installed and properly configured.Moreover, to reduce the risk of exploitation, Citrix recommends taking certain mitigation steps and restricting access to administrative interfaces until patches are in place. This includes implementing firewall rules and utilizing Access Control Lists (ACLs) to block certain IP addresses, as well as following other best practices. To receive the latest information about CVE-2019-20925, including any new updates or advisories, it is advisable to routinely check the Citrix security advisory website.
reference: An unauthenticated client can trigger denial of service by issuing specially crafted wire protocol messages, which cause the message decompressor to incorrectly allocate memory. This issue affects MongoDB Server v4.2 versions prior to 4.2.1; MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.13; MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.15 and MongoDB Server v3.4 versions prior to 3.4.24.

response: CVE-2019-2386 is a vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source framework for creating enterprise-grade Java web applications. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server side, leading to a remote code execution (RCE) attack. This occurs due to the improper handling of an error condition in the core of the Struts framework, specifically in the results defined in the XML configuration file.The latest details of this vulnerability reveal that it was first discovered in April 2019, and Apache quickly released a patch in Struts 2.5.17 and Struts 2.3.36. It is crucial to update any Apache Struts implementations to these versions or later to protect against potential attacks. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to a vulnerable server, which can result in unauthorized access, data theft, or server damage.To prevent falling victim to this vulnerability, system administrators should ensure that their Apache Struts deployments are up-to-date and have relevant patches applied. Regularly monitoring security advisories and updating the Struts framework promptly is essential to maintaining a secure environment. Furthermore, network and application firewalls can be configured to monitor and block suspicious traffic, which may help mitigate the risks associated with CVE-2019-2386.
reference: After user deletion in MongoDB Server the improper invalidation of authorization sessions allows an authenticated user's session to persist and become conflated with new accounts, if those accounts reuse the names of deleted ones. This issue affects MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.9; MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.13 and MongoDB Server v3.4 versions prior to 3.4.22. Workaround: After deleting one or more users, restart any nodes which may have had active user authorization sessions. Refrain from creating user accounts with the same name as previously deleted accounts.

response: CVE-2019-2390 is a vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source framework for creating enterprise-grade Java web applications. The vulnerability, which was disclosed in April 2019, allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server running the Apache Struts application, by exploiting their ability to upload Java objects onto the server. This can lead to a complete compromise of the server, potentially resulting in the loss of data or the installation of malware.The vulnerability specifically exists due to the improper handling of unvalidated user input in the "Content-Type" header of the HTTP request. When this header is not validated properly, it can allow an attacker to upload a malicious Crafted Object (e.g., a JSP file) which can then be executed by the server. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have network access to the Apache Struts application server and must have the ability to send a specially crafted HTTP request to it.The latest updates and patches related to CVE-2019-2390 have been released by the Apache Software Foundation, and users are strongly encouraged to apply these patches as soon as possible to prevent any potential attacks. Users who are unable to apply the patch can also mitigate the risk of exploitation by configuring their web server to reject any requests with a "Content-Type" that is not explicitly allowed.It is important to note that CVE-2019-2390 is just one in a long line of vulnerabilities discovered in Apache Struts, and as such, users should take steps to ensure their applications are secure and up-to-date. This includes conducting regular security audits, applying patches promptly, and following best practices for securing web applications.
reference: An unprivileged user or program on Microsoft Windows which can create OpenSSL configuration files in a fixed location may cause utility programs shipped with MongoDB server to run attacker defined code as the user running the utility. This issue MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to 4.0.11; MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.14 and MongoDB Server v3.4 prior to 3.4.22.

response: CVE-2019-5638 is a vulnerability related to the use of outdated versions of the Apache Struts library in web applications. Specifically, it affects applications using Struts 2.3.x before 2.3.34, and 2.5.x before 2.5.17. This vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server by sending a specially crafted request. This can result in a complete takeover of the affected server.The vulnerability arises due to the way the Jakarta FileUpload library is used in conjunction with the REST plugin in Apache Struts. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a malicious Content-Type value in the request header, which can lead to the execution of unintended code on the server.To mitigate this vulnerability, it's recommended to upgrade to the latest version of Apache Struts (2.3.34 or 2.5.17, depending on the version you're using). If upgrading isn't possible, there are patches available for older versions. It's also crucial to ensure that all web applications are regularly updated and patched to protect against known vulnerabilities. Please note that this is a serious vulnerability and if your application uses the affected versions of Apache Struts, you should prioritize updating as soon as possible to prevent potential attacks.
reference: Rapid7 Nexpose versions 6.5.50 and prior suffer from insufficient session expiration when an administrator performs a security relevant edit on an existing, logged on user. For example, if a user's password is changed by an administrator due to an otherwise unrelated credential leak, that user account's current session is still valid after the password change, potentially allowing the attacker who originally compromised the credential to remain logged in and able to cause further damage.

response: CVE-2020-0604 is a security vulnerability related to the Intel Processor Graphics (IGP) drivers. It affects Intel 6th through 10th generation processors, and the primary issue lies in the GPU's handling of certain malformed graphics commands. A potential attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) or escalate privileges, leading to possible arbitrary code execution.Intel first acknowledged this issue in January 2020 and has since released updated drivers to address CVE-2020-0604 for various operating systems, including Windows and Linux. It is highly recommended that users apply the necessary updates to ensure their systems are secure and protected against potential exploits. Always obtain updates from official sources to minimize the risk of downloading malware or tampered software.This specific vulnerability highlights the importance of regularly updating system drivers and software to maintain strong security practices. Ensuring your systems remain current can help protect against various threats and minimize potential attack surfaces.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Visual Studio Code when it process environment variables after opening a project. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the current user. If the current user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker could take control of the affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would need to convince a target to clone a repository and open it in Visual Studio Code. Attacker-specified code would execute when the target opened the integrated terminal. The update address the vulnerability by modifying the way Visual Studio Code handles environment variables.

response: CVE-2020-0648 is a vulnerability related to a use-after-free issue in the Microsoft Server Message Block 2.0 (SMB2) protocol, which can allow for remote code execution (RCE) on Windows systems. The vulnerability was discovered in February 2020 and affects Windows 10 (prior to v1903) and Windows Server 2016/2019. The issue is rooted in how SMB2 handles specially crafted requests that involve a particular sequence of function calls. Exploiting CVE-2020-0648 may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges, which could lead to a complete compromise of the affected system.Microsoft released a security update addressing CVE-2020-0648 in February 2020 as part of its monthly Patch Tuesday updates. It's strongly recommended that affected users apply these patches to protect their systems. Additionally, taking precautions such as blocking SMB2 from outside the network can help minimize the risk of exploitation. Since this vulnerability has the potential for remote code execution, it's crucial for system administrators to stay updated on security patches and apply them promptly to protect their infrastructures.
reference: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows RSoP Service Application improperly handles memory. To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker would first have to gain execution on the victim system. An attacker could then run a specially crafted application to elevate privileges. The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the Windows RSoP Service Application handles memory.

response: CVE-2020-0718 is a critical security vulnerability related to the Windows TCP/IP stack. It is a remote code execution (RCE) bug that allows an attacker to take control of an affected system remotely. The vulnerability exists due to how the TCP/IP stack handles ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) packets. Specifically, the vulnerability is triggered when a system receives a specially crafted ICMPv6 Router Advertisement message.Microsoft released a patch for this vulnerability in March 2020 as part of its monthly security updates. The patch addresses the issue by modifying how the Windows TCP/IP stack handles ICMPv6 Router Advertisement messages. It is highly recommended that all users apply this patch as soon as possible to protect their systems from potential attacks.It is worth noting that the vulnerability has been exploited in the wild, and there are reports of attackers using it to compromise unpatched systems. Therefore, it is crucial for organizations and individuals to prioritize the installation of the patch to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, implementing other security best practices, such as firewall rules and network segmentation, can help reduce the risk of attacks that exploit this vulnerability.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Active Directory integrated DNS (ADIDNS) mishandles objects in memory. An authenticated attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the Local System Account To exploit the vulnerability, an authenticated attacker could send malicious requests to an Active Directory integrated DNS (ADIDNS) server. The update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how Active Directory integrated DNS (ADIDNS) handles objects in memory.

response: CVE-2020-0761 is a security vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source framework for creating enterprise-ready Java web applications. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server hosting the Struts application, which can lead to a complete takeover of the server. This vulnerability exists due to a deserialization flaw in the implementation of the Jakarta Multipart Request (JMR) parser. Apache released a security advisory on February 24, 2020, urging users to update their Struts installations to versions 2.5.20 or 2.3.38, which contain fixes for this issue. response: CVE-2020-1045, also known as "Spectre V1.2," is a speculative execution side-channel vulnerability that was discovered in 2020. response: CVE-2020-1074 is a vulnerability in the Windows Operating System related to how the OS handles certain types of objects in memory. response: CVE-2020-1080 is a vulnerability related to the Microsoft Windows Codecs Library, which was publicly disclosed in April 2020. response: CVE-2020-1098 is a vulnerability related to Apache Struts, a popular open-source framework for creating enterprise-ready Java web applications. response: CVE-2020-1115 is a vulnerability associated with the Sudo command in Unix and Linux systems. Recently disclosed, it allows a user to execute commands with root privileges incorrectly. This occurs due to a time-of-check-to-time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in the sudoers file's plugin validation stage.The vulnerability specifically resides in versions 1.8.28 through 1.8.31 of Sudo, affecting a wide range of operating systems. If exploited, an attacker can escalate their privileges and execute arbitrary commands as a superuser, leading to potential system-wide compromise.Exploitation of this vulnerability can be prevented by updating to the latest version of Sudo (1.8.32 or higher), as it contains a patch for this issue. response: CVE-2020-1129 is a vulnerability related to the way the sudo command handles integer promotions in certain versions of the sudo library. This vulnerability, which was discovered in January 2020, affects sudo versions 1.8.2 through 1.8.31 and 1.9.0 through 1.9.5p1. The vulnerability allows an attacker to provide a carefully crafted input to the sudo command, resulting in the command being executed with root privileges even if the user is not in the sudoers file or is not authorized to execute the command with root privileges. This is due to a bug in the code that handles the conversion of user IDs (UIDs) to integers, leading to an out-of-bounds write which can be exploited to gain elevated privileges. It is recommended that users of affected sudo versions update to a version that contains a patch for this vulnerability as soon as possible.

response: CVE-2020-1167 is a security vulnerability associated with the Sudden OS Command Injection (Sudo) tool in Unix and Linux systems. The vulnerability allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges, bypassing security restrictions. It exists due to an error in the parsing of the command line by the sudo front-end, which can result in command injection when a user-specific sudoers file is used in combination with the '!' (bang) flag.The vulnerability was first made public in January 2020, and it affects sudo versions 1.8.2 through 1.8.23 and 1.8.27 through 1.8.30. Sudo developers have since released patches to fix the issue, and system administrators are advised to apply the updates as soon as possible to protect their systems.To mitigate the risk of this vulnerability, it is recommended to update the sudo package to the latest version, use the latest security configuration for sudo, and avoid using the '!' flag in sudoers files, especially in combination with user-specific rules. response: CVE-2020-1169 is a security vulnerability related to the iSCSI (Internet Small Computer System Interface) target service in Linux kernel versions 5.4 and newer. It is a use-after-free issue, which means that the iSCSI target subsystem does not properly handle certain memory allocations and deallocations, potentially leading to unstable system behavior or privilege escalation attacks. The vulnerability stems from improper management of "tpg_config" objects in the iSCSI target library.An attacker exploiting this vulnerability could potentially trigger a system crash or even execute arbitrary code with higher privileges than the user who initiated the iSCSI session. At the moment, the availability of exploits for CVE-2020-1169 in the wild is unclear. However, it is best to apply the necessary patches as soon as possible to avoid any potential security risks. The Linux kernel team has already addressed this issue, and updated kernel versions (5.4.62, 5.6.18, 5.7.15, and later) are available to mitigate the vulnerability.To stay safe, ensure that your Linux system is up-to-date and that relevant kernel patches have been applied. Additionally, monitor the official sites and resources for Linux kernel updates and maintain good security practices, such as the principle of least privilege and regular auditing. It is vital to take prompt action to secure your system against potential attacks leveraging CVE-2020-1169 or similar vulnerabilities in the future.

response: CVE-2020-1182 is a vulnerability related to the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC) in Microsoft's Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS). This weakness can allow an attacker to exploit a flaw in the way Netlogon handles the authentication process, enabling them to impersonate a domain controller and alter user identities or password hashes. The vulnerability can also allow an attacker to create a new domain controller within the target's existing Active Directory environment. Microsoft released a security update for this issue in August 2020 as part of its monthly software update cycle, addressing multiple CVEs, including CVE-2020-1182.To mitigate the risk, Microsoft advises enabling Extended Protection for Authentication (EPA) on domain controllers, enforcing secure RPC communication, and disabling the NSRL (Netlogon Secure Channel) service for non-DC computers within the domain. It's important to note that some legacy systems might not be compatible with the mitigation steps required to secure against this vulnerability; therefore, thorough testing should be carried out before applying these fixes in a production environment. Furthermore, disabling the NSRL service on any particular device or machine should be done after careful consideration to avoid network communication disruptions.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations (on-premises) version 10.0.11. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain remote code execution via server-side script execution on the victim server. An authenticated attacker with privileges to import and export data could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted file to a vulnerable Dynamics server. response: CVE-2020-1193 is a vulnerability related to the iCloud communication protocol that could potentially allow an attacker to manipulate the synchronization of user's data across different devices. This flaw was discovered in February 2020 and impacts iCloud services for iOS versions earlier than 13.3.3 and iPadOS earlier than 13.3.3.The vulnerability is found in the way iCloud handles failed file-upload requests, allowing hackers to send malicious responses triggering a buffer overflow issue. This could eventually lead to arbitrary code execution on the victim's device, providing potential unauthorized access to sensitive user information stored on iCloud.Apple quickly addressed this concern with the release of security updates (iOS 13.3.3 and iPadOS 13.3.3) to protect its users. reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Excel software when the software fails to properly handle objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the current user. If the current user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker could take control of the affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. Users whose accounts are configured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than users who operate with administrative user rights. In a web-based attack scenario, an attacker could host a website (or leverage a compromised website that accepts or hosts user-provided content) containing a specially crafted file designed to exploit the vulnerability. response: CVE-2020-1198 is a security vulnerability related to Microsoft SharePoint, which was fixed in February 2020. This vulnerability allows an attacker to elevate their privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the SharePoint application pool account, leading to a complete compromise of the SharePoint server. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of exception conditions, which can result in the disclosure of information that should be restricted to the user who initiated the SharePoint request. reference: A cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists when Microsoft SharePoint Server does not properly sanitize a specially crafted web request to an affected SharePoint server. An authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to an affected SharePoint server. The attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could then perform cross-site scripting attacks on affected systems and run script in the security context of the current user. The attacks could allow the attacker to read content that the attacker is not authorized to read, use the victim's identity to take actions on the SharePoint site on behalf of the user, such as change permissions and delete content, and inject malicious content in the browser of the user. The security update addresses the vulnerability by helping to ensure that SharePoint Server properly sanitizes web requests.

response: CVE-2020-1200 is a security vulnerability associated with the Windows Print Spooler component in Microsoft Windows operating systems. It was discovered and disclosed in 2020. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code with system privileges, potentially gaining complete control over the affected system. This is accomplished through the submission of a specially crafted print job to a print server, which then triggers the vulnerability when processed.The impact of this vulnerability is significant due to its exploitation potential and the wide array of systems that may be affected. reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft SharePoint when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package. response: CVE-2020-1218 is a security vulnerability related to OpenSSL, a popular cryptography library used for secure communication. The vulnerability was discovered in early 2020 and impacts versions 1.0.2 and 1.1.1 of OpenSSL. It specifically relates to the Transport Layer Security (TLS) handshake, which is used for establishing secure connections.The vulnerability allows for a malicious client or server to perform a padding oracle attack against a connection using AES-NI in CTR mode. In this attack, the attacker can potentially decrypt sensitive information and even inject unauthorized data into the communication stream.OpenSSL released patches for this vulnerability in February 2020. To address the issue, users are advised to upgrade to OpenSSL version 1.0.2p, 1.1.1b, or newer. The patches remove the ability for an attacker to perform a padding oracle attack, thereby mitigating the risk.It is important to note that, while this vulnerability can have serious consequences if exploited, there are no known instances of CVE-2020-1218 being actively exploited in the wild. It is still crucial for administrators and developers to apply the necessary patches and maintain a secure environment for their applications and systems.
reference: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Word software when it fails to properly handle objects in memory. For example, the file could then take actions on behalf of the logged-on user with the same permissions as the current user. response: CVE-2020-1228 is a vulnerability related to the Microsoft Server Message Block 3.1.1 (SMBv3) protocol, which can be exploited by a remote, unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. This vulnerability exists due to improper handling of malformed packets, allowing an attacker to trigger a null pointer dereference, resulting in the affected system crashing.The vulnerability was disclosed in June 2020 as part of Microsoft's monthly security updates and affects Windows 10 (versions 1903 and 1909) and Windows Server 2019. The impact of this vulnerability is relatively high because SMBv3 is widely used in enterprise environments. However, a successful exploitation does not result in remote code execution (RCE), limiting the potential damage.Microsoft released security patches to fix this issue, and system administrators are advised to apply these updates immediately to protect their systems from potential attacks. In addition, enabling SMBv3 compression can increase the attack surface; thus, disabling it can provide an additional layer of security as a workaround until the patch is applied. reference: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Windows DNS when it fails to properly handle queries.
